channel.title: [PI]Combat Level
channel.description:
On final judgment source, the max combat level you can have is 126.
Sice it has summoning, is there anyway to make summon gives you combat level, and now have max cb lvl of 138?

item.title: [PI]Combat Level
item.dc:creator: @Soviet Soviet
item.description:
@Soviet wrote:

Lol, I useed a google tutorial :P, was easy, lol my post above please… any idea?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Combat Level
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote author=teh one link=topic=502798.msg3678580#msg3678580 date=1311381468]
I don’t know if this will help you, but someone posted this a while back, seemed to help a few people with this problem.

[code][quote=“Primadude”]As far as I am aware, summoning gives the same amount of combat levels as prayer does. Therefore, we simply just need to use the same formulae as prayer does (level * 1.125) = combat level to add on.

I’ve tested this and, if all levels are at 99 (Including summoning), then the output combat level is 138 ;).

[code=java] int magic = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5);
int ranged = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5);
int melee = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])));
int summoning = (int)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) * 0.125);
int combatLevel = (int) (summoning + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) * 0.125));

	if (ranged > melee) {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) * 0.4875));
	} else if (magic > melee) {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) * 0.4875));
	} else {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) * 0.325) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) * 0.325));
	}[/code][/quote]

You do know that’s not even the right code.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Combat Level
item.dc:creator: @Soviet Soviet
item.description:
@Soviet wrote:

[quote author=teh one link=topic=502798.msg3678580#msg3678580 date=1311381468]
I don’t know if this will help you, but someone posted this a while back, seemed to help a few people with this problem.

[code][quote=“Primadude”]As far as I am aware, summoning gives the same amount of combat levels as prayer does. Therefore, we simply just need to use the same formulae as prayer does (level * 1.125) = combat level to add on.

I’ve tested this and, if all levels are at 99 (Including summoning), then the output combat level is 138 ;).

[code=java] int magic = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5);
int ranged = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5);
int melee = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])));
int summoning = (int)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) * 0.125);
int combatLevel = (int) (summoning + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) * 0.125));

	if (ranged > melee) {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) * 0.4875));
	} else if (magic > melee) {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) * 0.4875));
	} else {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) * 0.325) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) * 0.325));
	}[/code][/quote]

Lol I needed the code in client class and player class, but I got it now, thanks anyway!

Btw, imsuperman05

Since now I have 138 combat, well I have some PvP areas that appears the level RANGE to fight, since am 138 appears this:

126-126, any idea how to change it to: 138?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Combat Level
item.dc:creator: @teh_one teh one
item.description:
@teh_one wrote:

I don’t know if this will help you, but someone posted this a while back, seemed to help a few people with this problem.

[code][quote author=Primadude link=action=profile;u=235977 date=1284201395]
As far as I am aware, summoning gives the same amount of combat levels as prayer does. Therefore, we simply just need to use the same formulae as prayer does (level * 1.125) = combat level to add on.

I’ve tested this and, if all levels are at 99 (Including summoning), then the output combat level is 138 ;).

[code=java] int magic = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5);
int ranged = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5);
int melee = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])));
int summoning = (int)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) * 0.125);
int combatLevel = (int) (summoning + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) * 0.125));

	if (ranged > melee) {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) * 0.4875));
	} else if (magic > melee) {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) * 0.4875));
	} else {
		combatLevel += (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) * 0.25) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) * 0.325) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) * 0.325));
	}[/code]

Read full topic
